solution.text:
\( \frac{_{j}_}4 + \frac {-_{m}_}6 \)
LCM of the denominators of the 2 fractions, i.e. 4 and 6 = 12.
Writing both the fractions with common denominator, i.e. 12, we get:
\( (\frac {_{j}_}4 \times \frac33) + (\frac {-_{m}_}6 \times \frac22)\)
\(= \frac {_{{j*3}}_}{12} - \frac {_{{2*m}}_}{12} \)
\(= \frac{_{{j*3}}_ - _{{2*m}}_}{12}\)
\(= _{{Fraction((3*j)-(2*m), 12)}}_\)
